title: Session methods used before they are initialized
body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
After this bugix:
[Bug #15523](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/24f4e3126a9f6562a78ea55ad058f9c155ef09af)

When I use:

```
$config = [
    'components' => [
        'cache' => [
            'class' => yii\mongodb\Cache::className(),
        ],
        'session' => [
            'class' => yii\web\CacheSession::className(),
            'useCookies' => true,
            'timeout' => 60 * 60 * 24 * 14,
        ],
    ]
];
```

But I've noticed that any other session has this problem too

### What is the expected result?
Sessions are initialized and just work.

### What do you get instead?
It seems that the new methods `freeze()` and `unfreeze()` are triggering `readSession()` before `init()` is called resulting in reading `$this->cache->get($this->calculateKey($id));` when `$this->cache` is just a string at that moment since it was not initialized in `init()` as `$this->cache = Instance::ensure($this->cache, 'yii\caching\CacheInterface');`
